intro: Eriocalia leucocephala, commonly known as the white-headed eriocalia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
